Class BookController

java.lang.Object
com.library.library_management.data.presentation.controllers.admin.BookController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/books") public class BookController extends Object
Controller class responsible for managing books within the library management system.

This class handles HTTP requests related to book management, including listing, adding, updating, and deleting books. It uses the BookDAO and PublisherDAO to interact with the data layer and facilitates communication between the system and the user interface through view templates.

Marked with the Controller annotation, this class is part of the Spring MVC framework and processes requests under the /books path.

  • Constructor Details

    • BookController

      public BookController(BookDAO bookDAO, PublisherDAO publisherDAO)
      Constructs a new BookController with the specified DAOs for books and publishers.
      Parameters:
      bookDAO - the DAO used for book-related operations
      publisherDAO - the DAO used for publisher-related operations

  • Method Details

    • showBooks

      @GetMapping public String showBooks(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles HTTP GET requests to display the list of all books.

      Fetches a list of books from the data layer using the BookDAO.getAll() method and populates the model with it. The returned view template renders these books for the admin interface.

      Parameters:
      model - the Model object used to pass attributes to the view
      Returns:
      the name of the view template for displaying books

    • deleteBook

      @PostMapping("/delete/{id}") public String deleteBook(@PathVariable("id") int id)
      Handles HTTP POST requests to delete a book by its ID.

      Uses the BookDAO.delete(int) method to delete the specified book from the data layer. Redirects to the /books endpoint after successful deletion.

      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the book to be deleted
      Returns:
      a redirect to the books list view

    • showUpdateForm

      @GetMapping("/update/{id}") public String showUpdateForm(@PathVariable("id") int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles HTTP GET requests to display the form for updating a specific book.

      Fetches the book by its ID using BookDAO.getById(int) and the list of publishers using PublisherDAO.getAll(). Populates the model with these details to render the update form.

      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the book to update
      model - the Model object used to pass attributes to the view
      Returns:
      the name of the view template for updating the book

    • updateBook

      @PostMapping("/update") public String updateBook(@ModelAttribute Book book)
      Handles HTTP POST requests to update a book.

      Updates the specified book in the data layer using BookDAO.update(Book). Redirects to the /books endpoint after the update is complete.

      Parameters:
      book - the updated Book object to save
      Returns:
      a redirect to the books list view

    • showAddForm

      @GetMapping("/add") public String showAddForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles HTTP GET requests to display the form for adding a new book.

      Initializes a new Book object and fetches the list of publishers using PublisherDAO.getAll(). Populates the model with these details to render the add form.

      Parameters:
      model - the Model object used to pass attributes to the view
      Returns:
      the name of the view template for adding a new book

    • addBook

      @PostMapping("/add") public String addBook(@ModelAttribute Book book)
      Handles HTTP POST requests to add a new book.

      Inserts the new book into the data layer using BookDAO.insert(Book). Redirects to the /books endpoint after the book has been added.

      Parameters:
      book - the new Book object to add
      Returns:
      a redirect to the books list view
